I had a quick look at this, the broadcasting still happens, but only if the dimension is not present:

a = torch.rand(10, 10, 10)
b = a[0] > 0
a[b] # works
a[b.unsqueeze(0)]  # doesn't work

This check is too restrictive, and doesn't allow broadcasting dimensions with size 1.

body:
I had a quick look at this, the broadcasting still happens, but only if the dimension is not present:
```python
a = torch.rand(10, 10, 10)
b = a[0] > 0
a[b] # works
a[b.unsqueeze(0)]  # doesn't work
```

[This check](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/aten/src/ATen/native/Indexing.cpp#L66) is too restrictive, and doesn't allow broadcasting dimensions with size 1.
